sentences.en: A person from whom one is descended , especially if more remote than a grandparent; a forebear.
sentences.cn: 繁衍后代的人, 特别是远于祖父辈; 前辈.

sentences.en: Consider how much more frugal the poor are than we, how much better they forebear hardship.
sentences.cn: 想想贫困的人比我们节俭多少,他们忍受困境比我们强多少.

sentences.en: I had much ado to forebear laughing.
sentences.cn: 我费了很大的劲才忍住笑.

sentences.en: I'll come back to the land of my forebears.
Moderation: Avoid extremes. Forebear resenting injuries so much as you think they deserve.
sentences.cn: 适度: 避免极端. 克制怨恨会带来多大的伤害仅在自己一念之间.

trans.tran_en: someone who was a member of your family a long time in the past
